description: The Manager resource describes a manager.  Examples of managers are BMCs, Enclosure Managers, Management Controllers and other subSystems assigned manageability functions.

ResetType@Redfish.AllowableValues.description: The supported values for the ResetType parameter.

enumDescriptions.ForceRestart: Perform a reset of the management processor firmware
enumDescriptions.GracefulRestart: Perform a graceful shutdown followed by a restart of the system.

ResetType@Redfish.AllowableValues.longDescription: The supported values for the ResetType parameter.

CommandShell.description: The value of this property shall contain the information about the Command Shell service of this manager.

ConnectTypesSupported.description: This object is used to enumerate the Command Shell connection types allowed by the implementation.

enumDescriptions.IPMI: The controller supports a Command Shell connection using the IPMI Serial-over-LAN (SOL) protocol
enumDescriptions.Oem: The controller supports a Command Shell connectino using an OEM-specific protocol
enumDescriptions.SSH: The controller supports a Command Shell connection using the SSH protocol
enumDescriptions.Telnet: The controller supports a Command Shell connection using the Telnet protocol

MaxConcurrentSessions.description: This is the maximum number of Command Shell sessions, regardless of protocol, that this manager supports.

ServiceEnabled.description: Indicates if the Command Shell service is enabled for this manager.

DateTime.description: The current DateTime (with offset) for the manager, used to set or read time.
DateTime.longDescription: The value of this property shall represent the current DateTime value for the manager, with offset from UTC, in Redfish Timestamp format.

DateTimeLocalOffset.description: The time offset from UTC that the DateTime property is set to in format: +06:00 .
DateTimeLocalOffset.longDescription: This property shall represent the offset from UTC time that the current value of DataTime property contains.

EthernetInterfaces.description: This is a reference to a collection of NICs that this manager uses for network communication.  It is here that clients will find NIC configuration options and settings.

FirmwareVersion.description: The firmware version of this Manager
FirmwareVersion.longDescription: This property shall contain the firwmare version as defined by the manufacturer for the associated manager.

GraphicalConsole.description: The value of this property shall contain the information about the Graphical Console (KVM-IP) service of this manager.

ConnectTypesSupported.description: This object is used to enumerate the Graphical Console connection types allowed by the implementation.

enumDescriptions.KVMIP: The controller supports a Graphical Console connection using a KVM-IP (redirection of Keyboard, Video, Mouse over IP) protocol
enumDescriptions.Oem: The controller supports a Graphical Console connection using an OEM-specific protocol

MaxConcurrentSessions.description: Indicates the maximum number of Graphical Console sessions, regardless of protocol, this manager supports.

ServiceEnabled.description: Indicates if the Command Shell service is enabled for this manager.

HostInterfaces.description: This is a reference to a collection of Host Interfaces that this manager uses for local host communication.  It is here that clients will find Host Interface configuration options and settings.
HostInterfaces.longDescription: The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type HostInterfaceCollection.

Links.description: The links array contains links to resources related to this resource.

ManagerForChassis.description: This property is an array of references to the chassis that this manager controls.

ManagerForServers.description: This property is an array of references to the servers that this manager controls.

ManagerInChassis.description: This property is a reference to the chassis that this manager is located within.

LogServices.description: Reference to a resource of type Collection with a MemberType of Logs.

ManagerType.description: This property is the manager type for this resource.

enumDescriptions.BMC: A controller which provides management functions for a single computer system
enumDescriptions.EnclosureManager: A controller which provides management functions for a chassis or group of devices or Systems
enumDescriptions.ManagementController: A controller used primarily to monitor or manage the operation of a device or system

NetworkProtocol.description: This is a reference to the network services and their settings that the manager controls.  It is here that clients will find network configuration options as well as network services.

Redundancy.description: Details of redundancy for this manager. This is present only if it is applicable.

SerialConsole.description: The value of this property shall contain the information about the Serial Console service of this manager.

ConnectTypesSupported.description: This object is used to enumerate the Serial Console connection types allowed by the implementation.

enumDescriptions.IPMI: The controller supports a Serial Console connection using the IPMI Serial-over-LAN (SOL) protocol
enumDescriptions.SSH: The controller supports a Serial Console connection using the SSH protocol
enumDescriptions.Telnet: The controller supports a Serial Console connection using the Telnet protocol

MaxConcurrentSessions.description: This is the maximum number of Serial Console sessions, regardless of protocol, that this manager supports.

ServiceEnabled.description: Indicates if the Command Shell service is enabled for this manager.

SerialInterfaces.description: The link to a collection of serial interfaces that this manager uses for serial and console communication.
SerialInterfaces.longDescription: This property shall contain a link to a resource collection of type SerialInterfaceCollection, which this manager uses.

UUID.description: This is a universally unique identifier that supervisory software uses to uniquely identify this manager. The UUID is assigned when the system is manufactured.

VirtualMedia.description: This is a reference to the virtual media services for this manager.

title: #Manager.v1_5_1.Manager
